title: Ticket #3011: large accountant logs cause very long negotiator reconfigs
description:
There is a scaling problem with large accountant logs that can be seen when using reconfigs and also on startup. A 25MB log can require a 60 sec reconfig. This causes problems when trying to keep negotiation cycles short and the period between cycles stable.

I've tracked this down to n^2 in Accountant::Initialize. The accountant reads the accountant log into a table. Accountant::Initialize runs through this table looking at all the CustomerRecords and creates a user list. Then it iterates through the user list and for each user calls Accountant::ReportState. Accountant::ReportState iterates through the table looking at every ResourceRecord to match the user.
remarks:
2012-Aug-21 13:32:47 by eje:
REPRO:

No special configuration is required except to enable D_ACCOUNTANT: 

NEGOTIATOR_DEBUG = D_FULLDEBUG | D_ACCOUNTANT

The important thing is to generate a large accountant ClassAd log table, which can be done by starting up a pool, and using condor_setprio to generate entries in the accountant table: 

$ condor_master

# create 5000 user entries in the accountant:
$ time for j in {0..5000}; do condor_userprio -setprio user"$j"@localdomain 1.0; done > /dev/null

real	7m18.727s
user	1m20.221s
sys	0m49.676s

Next, stop the negotiator, then begin listening on the NegotiatorLog: 

$ condor_off -neg
$ tail -f NegotiatorLog | grep -e 'Sanity check' -e 'NEGOTIATOR_POST_JOB_RANK'

In another terminal, now re-start the negotiator using "condor_on -neg". Verify that sanity checking happens, and that it takes some measurable time (in my case, it was about 15 seconds, with 5000 user entries): 

$ tail -f NegotiatorLog | grep -e 'Sanity check' -e 'NEGOTIATOR_POST_JOB_RANK'
08/21/12 11:21:07 Sanity check on number of resources per user
08/21/12 11:21:22 NEGOTIATOR_POST_JOB_RANK = 0

Next, in the other terminal, invoke "condor_reconfig -neg" to reconfigure the negotiator. Back on the log output, verify that the sanity check happens again - this sanity check is redundant, since the negotiator has already started and checked its entries: 

08/21/12 11:21:33 Sanity check on number of resources per user
08/21/12 11:21:47 NEGOTIATOR_POST_JOB_RANK = 0

2012-Aug-21 13:46:37 by eje:
TEST:

to test the fix, use the same procedure as the REPRO above. However, there should now be two differences. After invoking "condor_on -neg", the initial sanity check should be faster. In my case, I measured about 5 seconds instead of the original 15 seconds: 

$ tail -f NegotiatorLog | grep -e 'Sanity check' -e 'NEGOTIATOR_POST_JOB_RANK'
08/21/12 11:43:03 Sanity check on number of resources per user
08/21/12 11:43:08 NEGOTIATOR_POST_JOB_RANK = 0

After invoking "condor_reconfig -neg" to reconfigure, there should be no sanity check from the reconfiguration: 

08/21/12 11:43:18 NEGOTIATOR_POST_JOB_RANK = 0
